title: OOI Array Locations
caption: The Ocean Observatories Initiative (OOI) has hundreds of instruments collecting data every minute of every day from seven locations (arrays) throughout the Pacific and Atlantic Oceans. In this activity, we will look at data from a glider in the northeast Pacific ocean at Station Papa (red dot), the Oregon Slope Base site on the Cabled Array (yellow), and the Upstream Offshore Profiler on the Coastal Pioneer array off the coast of New England (red)
